intro: Rapanea sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran boxwood, is a small evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in panicles, followed by dark blue berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and hill forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
